userreviews.userName: Nissa | Of Pens and Pages Book Blog
userreviews.userReview: 3.5 starsWould you consider meeting the love of your life in the men's room—your hand in a toilet—as a meet-cute? Because that's exactly how mystery shopper Shannon Jacoby met almost billionaire Declan McCormack. The second meeting isn't exactly the best either, but despite the weird encounters, Declan seems to be incredibly into Shannon. And the feeling is mutual.This series definitely has some OTT antics that either make me laugh out loud or cringe my soul out of my body, but I know I had to read the rest. It's like crack, and I can't get enough. I'm not usually a fan of the insta-love/lust trope, which I think this book kind of has (the events that occur in the first novella span two days, I think), but I think it was dealt with nicely. I have to admit I skimmed through some pages. I think the book would have been enjoyable if Declan's perspective was added in (which it was, as a bonus). Other than that, I enjoyed the first novella and the collection overall.I read this as a whole (the boxed set features the first 5 novellas in the series), so I will be reviewing the other novellas and the collection separately.

I found this book on Amazon as one of their "free books" and decided to download it onto my Kindle as I usually find Chick-Lit to be perfect as a quick read when out and about. However, I'm surprised I made it through the book.I'm actually very surprised by the high reviews this series has gotten. Personally, I found myself skimming through some parts, especially at the beginning. It did get better towards the end and that's the only reason I finished the book. And, imagine my surprise when the book ends and I realized only a day had gone by in the characters world. Considering how little actually happened in the book, I'm betting all 4 books in the series is enough to make one complete novel.I don't know if this was just me but wow, did the author put every reference she could into the book. From plentyoffish to Honey Boo Boo, this book had it all. And I wasn't a fan.

2.5 StarsShopping for a billionaire is a novella that can be read on it's own but does have another story that follows the same characters. While I did laugh out loud a couple of times, I mostly found myself getting a bit bogged down in the heroines inner ramblings. I found myself skimming parts and in such a short book, things get missed that way. I did stop and go back but just couldn't find a way to connect. I also wanted to like the hero but since he barely talked at all, I was really unable to have an opinion on him one way or the other. While the first meeting the two had was super cute. It quickly turned a tad too awkward for me. Then all the side characters were just as odd creating a storyline that seemed to go one way then quickly turn direction. And listening to the heroine talk to herself most of the time just really wasn't my cup of tea. This is a case in which I wanted to like the book as a whole more than I actually did even if parts of it did keep me entertained.
So freaking cute! On to the next one.
Really cute and fun story. The narration was five stars. I'm super interested in moving on.

***** 4 Stars *****A quick fun rom com. I loved it! If you enjoy awkward situations, pick this up!As a secret shopper, Shannon has so get involved with some odd shops... Like examining the men's bathroom. When Declan catches her in an questionable position, he can't stop thinking about her. This book had me giggling, and I will definitely be read the next book as soon as possible.
Cute..... funny read
3.5 Very Funny Stars

Wow!! I totally underestimated this book! I walked into it thinking it was a humdrum smutty serial. I was so very wrong!! To my utter shock this is a fun witty romance, with only a couple kisses!!! It is a serial, but I am willing to forgive that, because all the parts have been released on audio already. So, no nasty waiting time for me! Hooray!!!Shannon is a sassy, snarky curvy gal!! Just the sort I adore!! I loved her from the very start. How could you not!! I found my self laughing at her antics and never wanting it to end! The whole book is from her POV, which make it essential that she have an awesome personality, which she does!!! Declan is yummy and totally into her from the start. I would love to get him in the narration, it would help me see his side of the flirtation. I am very excited to see how it will all progress in the next book.In addition to how fabulous Shannon is, there are all the quirky fun supporting characters. From her grumpy cat to her outspoken mom, her bff and her cheapskate boss. This book is bursting at the seems with all the fun and witty banter!!! I had to pick up the ebook, just so I could make favorite quotes on Goodreads!!I listened to the audiobook narrated by Tanya Eby, who is delightful! She has the perfect tone for the vibe of this book. I love the way she adds energy and sass to the characters. She keeps the story moving right along with her swift pace. The men's voice are just masculine enough, without seeming like a caricature. Definitely a narrator I will be looking for more of in the future! She gives good voice!!!The book leaves off at on okay point, just starting things out and ready to see what comes next. As a general rule, I do not like books that are delivered piece mail. However, this one being all out already helps soften that for me. Pick up this first book free on Amazon and then get the audio on a whispersync deal. You will be just as hooked as I am!Disclosure - I received a copy of this book in exchange for an honest review. All thoughts, opinions and ratings are my own.

This book is only a little over 100 pages and 2-1/2 hours long (audiobook) and I couldn't even bring myself to finish it. I got through a third of the book and just couldn't do it any longer. The 5 minute audio sample was cute and the book is billed as a "romantic comedy" so I was looking forward to it. I had the kindle version (free, thank goodness) and the audio book was only $1.99 (a good deal, I thought). Do not waste your time or your money on this. After the 5 minute sample the book goes downhill quickly. The lead character (Shannon) goes on and on about the body/figure/looks of the main character (Declan) whom she has not yet met and fantasizes about how great it would be to touch him (and do more). And she goes on and on and on, ad nauseum-- multiple times, multiple scenes all within the first third of the book that I made it through. The comedic parts that I got to, I did not find particularly funny, mostly I thought they were dumb. The further I got into the book, the more grating I found Shannon. I just couldn't deal with her, so I gave up. Very disappointing. I had such high hopes for it.

בהתחלה הספר נראה כעוד אחד מהספרים בסדרות הבלתי נגמרות על בחורה צעירה וקצת קלולסית שננטשת ע"י ארוסה רק כדי ליפול כפרי בשל לידי המליונר הבא. לפעמים אותו מליונר גם נושא תכונות אופי ממש מדכאות ושרוטות שהן תוצר של ילדותו העשוקה וחסרת אהבת אם.אבל זה לא המקרה עם שאנון ודאקלן. שאנון טיפוס עם אינטרוספקטיבה מספיק כנה כדי לראות את עצמה ואת משפחתה ההזויה באור בהיר. הסצנה של הדייט הראשון פשוט מצחיקה במיוחד הקטע אם אמא שלה שמלווה אותה לדייט העיסקי ומתנהגת כאילו הם חתן וכלה.גם דקאלן לא סובל משריטות עמוקות מידי והמפגשים שלו עם שאנון משעשעים והזויים. חמוד ביותר כהתחלה ל 10 ספרים.הטיפוסים מספיק אקסצנטרים בכדי שהיא לא תדרש לסקס כבר בספרון הראשון, ומאידך המתח המיני קיים. כך שזו התחלה טובה (אם כי קצרה מידי )
This is hilarious and so hot! Why am I just now discovering it?

It was ok..... I honestly found the character a bit shallow and not very likeable..... it says she has OCD, if that was truly the case a person with OCD would not stick their hand down a public men's toilet for a phone in the first place, and definitely wouldn't make a coffee before showering.But ok i like the fact a normal looking girl gets the guy for once, and some bits were really funny.
Listening to the audio version

After seeing Shopping for a Billionaire on Audible for a good price through Whispersync, I decided that it couldn't hurt to give this series a try; after all, I do love a good chick-lit novel. I was extremely disappointed with the results.It isn't that the novel was awful per say, it was more the fact that the story lacked perspective; I felt like most of the plot took place in Shannon's head, where she spent much of her time objectifying and mentally undressing Declan - it got tiring and hard to follow after awhile. Additionally, I found that the comedic moments in this "romantic comedy were over the top and more awkward than funny.Overall, despite having high hopes for this series, I was greatly disappointed. I believe that the concept behind the story was intriguing but poorly executed in this case. I would not recommend this particular book unless you are already a fan of the author's work.

Tale of the Mystery ShopperI was completely thrilled to receive this first brand new wonderful book. Written by brand new exciting author, Julia Kent. I simply adored this first series the sexy and romance series, Shopping for a Billionaire. Both hilarious and brilliant for the first time I just adored this fun and extraordinary new romantic story I just so thoroughly enjoyed.After Shannon Jacoby, has now arrived at work early this Monday morning work as Mystery Shopper . Just the happiest job that anyone could do. Now suffering a complete dry spell with her romantic life. Shannon is just the sweetest, lively and funny young woman who suffers as a plus size dresser herself.I thoroughly enjoyed this fun and enjoyable most entertaining and romantic book.* I recommend this book to everyone!!

What a pleasant surprise this little beauty was. Shopping for the billionaire is quite the funny read. The main characters first encounter was absolutely hilarious and seriously embarrassing, I actually hid my face for her, That poor girl. Let’s not start on how embarrassing her mother and friend are, good god. This is my first read by Julia Kent and I’m excited to say it was this book, it was fun, short and sexy, I loved it.
This book had me laughing from the very beginning. Shannon is a riot.

Fun! I'm not sure if this would trigger people's secondhand embarrassment, but I appreciated that the heroine deals with embarrassment the same way I do: basically shrugging and saying, "Oh well, that happened."I also appreciated the lowkey serious observations, specifically the lack of women the heroine tends to interact with in meetings.
Sounded cute but not something I could really get into
12/26/14 - free on Kindle
A fun read for a rainy afternoon. A down-to-earth heroine with a good sense of humor, and a hero who sees the real woman inside.
A fun, easy, no thoughts required, funny read. Not spectacular, but not a waste of time either. Decent entertainment for a couple hours.

chanced upon this book while i was on goodreads and decided to give it go. wanted something short and sweet, and this was it (it was extremely short though, barely over a 100 pages). i liked the chemistry between shannon and declan. i loved shannon's sarcasm, her wit is amazing and she's so weird too. her awkwardness made the book a really fun read. her first encounter with declan was hilarious, i couldn't help but burst out laughing. this is my first time reading anything from Julia Kent, but i'm already looking forward to the rest of the series. ON TO THE NEXT PART!

This was pretty good. I liked the characters and their personalities. Emotions, snark, funnies, a little steaminess, but....Cliff Hanger!!!! I didn't like the cliffy. I was really enjoying myself til then and it definitely disappointed me. It was fun while it lasted though and got me into it and turning pages because you just have to see what could possibly happen next. ;) Enjoy

2.5*i'm sorry, is this a book ?? this isn't even a novella! IT's so short and random! IT has great potential , so i don't understand why the author was too lazy to actually develop and finish the story she began?!
Cute enough that I bought the whole set. Way too short but a funny, light read.
Really short read but also a breath of fresh air! This book was really funny at the beginning but lost some of the funny towards the end. Very upbeat though! Wish it was longer. 3.5 stars!
Joyful, short, fun read.
Cute story and a pretty quick read. Some parts were really funny.

description: When mystery shopper Shannon Jacoby meets billionaire Declan McCormick with her hand down a toilet in the men's room of one of his stores, it's love at first flush in this hilarious new romantic comedy from New York Times bestselling author Julia Kent.
title:
Shopping for a Billionaire
      
          (Shopping for a Billionaire #1)
